column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1. Introduction
#Text=One of the most common types of degradation of polymers is induced by Ultraviolet ( UV ) light radiation which produces highly reactive free radicals .
#Text=The so-called aging process is a result of photodegradation and color fading of polymers .
#Text=A wide range of additives are included in thermoplastic films to avoid UV light aging .
#Text=These UV blocking compounds are classified based on the blocking mechanism : shielding by inorganic additives and UV light absorption by organic species .
#Text=The thermal performance of the final product is one of the most important aspects to be taken into consideration since the processing of thermoplastic films occurs at high temperatures .
#Text=In this case , inorganic additives usually are more stable at high temperatures than the organic additives .
#Text=Besides , the UV energy absorbed can be dissipated as heat promoting a thermal aging of the thermoplastic matrix causing a loss of the mechanical properties .
#Text=In addition , organic UV absorbers migrate to the surface of the plastic due to their volatility and different polarity , so the plastic matrix loses its UV protection over time .
#Text=However , there are several strategies to reduce these negative effects .

#Text=For example , the usage of layered double hydroxides ( LDH ) as host matrix of organic compounds results into a hybrid absorber which can block the UV light , increasing the thermal and photostability of the nanocomposite .

#Text=Layered double hydroxides ( LDH ) are anionic clays represented by the general formula of [ M2+1−xM3+x(OH)2]x+(An−)x/n·mH2O , where M2+ and M3+ are divalent and trivalent metallic cations and An− depicts the anions which can be present in the hydrated interlayer galleries of the clay .
#Text=The value of x is in the range of 0.20 – 0.33 .
#Text=Therefore , positively-charged metal hydroxide layers are intercalated with anions in order to keep the materials electroneutrality .
#Text=The cations fill octahedral sites having hydroxide ions in the vertices .
#Text=These anions are weakly bound to the structure and ion exchange reactions are suitable for the modification of LDHs .
#Text=LDHs composed of Mg and Al hydroxyl sheets with carbonate ions as counter anions and M2+ : M3+ = 3:1 are called hydrotalcite , and quintinite when the ratio M2+ : M3+ = 2:1 .

#Text=LDHs have attracted the attention of the scientific community due to their unique properties such as anion exchange ability , thermal stability and easy production and the promising applications in different fields of adsorption , sensors , biomedicine , polymer additives , among others .
#Text=LDH host layers promote the thermal and optical stabilization of the exchanged anions .
#Text=Many thermoplastic materials such as polyethylene ( PE ) do not contain polar groups in their backbone .
#Text=Therefore , a homogenous dispersion of clay platelets at a nonmetric level is a challenging aim in this technology .
#Text=The addition of compatibilizers has been proven to favor the exfoliation of hydrotalcite particles .
#Text=In this work , we have evaluated the effect on the viscoelastic , mechanical and optical properties of the addition of a polar whitening agent to low density polyethylene .
#Text=A modified LDH hosting the anionic whitening agent has been prepared .
#Text=The research compares the effect on the polymeric matrix to the addition of the whitening agent , the modified LDH , and also the addition of a commercial surfactant .
#Text=A characterization of the LDHs has been performed by means of XRD , TGA and FT – IR .
#Text=The viscoelastic behavior at different temperatures of the resulting nanocomposite has been performed to evaluate the impact on processing conditions .
#Text=The mechanical and optical properties have been also determined .
